result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody L Raugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Court stays 15 days of the jail sentence and is to be used by the Agent for disciplinary purposes.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days and may be served with huber.  Sentence may be served in another county, if it can be arranged and at no additional cost to Green Lake County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kody L Raugh

records.addlTxt:
8:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - defendant will enter a plea to count 1 and dismiss and read-in count 2.  DA concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Both counsel waive request for PSI.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Lennon.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

AODA and any follow-up
court costs
30 days county jail, with huber and another 15 days is to be used by the probation agent for disciplinary purposes
60 days to commence sentence
Sentence may be served in another county if it can be arranged and at no additional costs to Green Lake County
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

DA has no objection to return the personal items.  Court orders the personal items be returned to the defendant.  Atty Lennon to submit an order.

Court adjourned at 8:54 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-15-2015 08:30 am

9:14 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - has received an offer and needs to talk with the defendant.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on June 15, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  

Court adjourned at 9:15 a.m.
Status hearing at 05-18-2015 09:00 am

9:09 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney William Lennon present via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - case is not resolved, and still speaking with the District Attorney.  Court will set for Status Hearing in 30 days - May 18, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:10 a.m.
State's
Status hearing at 04-20-2015 09:00 am

2:53 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty William Lennon via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon, requests a status hearing in 30 days.  Court will set for status hearing on April 20, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:54 p.m.

1:59 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - time limits need to be addressed.  Statement by Atty Lennon - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Lennon and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Lennon enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court will set for Status Hearing in approx 30-60 days.

Court adjourned at 2:02 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
By Atty William Lennon
Status hearing on February 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is not to possess any illegal items or prescription items without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on March 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is not to possess any illegal items or prescription items without a valid prescription.

3:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video with Atty BArb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is not to possess any illegal items or prescription items without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.  Court will set for preliminary hearing.

Court adjourned at 3:10 p.m.
